name: Automated Resume Scoring with Gemini LLM, Gmail and Notion Job Profiles

user.name: Agentick AI
user.bio: At Agentick AI we are passionate about building automation systems that drive efficiency and unlock scale for individuals and businesses. With a deep interest how n8n can power smarter decisions and reduce manual effort. We work solving real-world problems with structured automation, creating scalable solutions, and pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible through N8N. Constantly learning, testing, and iterating.

description:
**This n8n template demonstrates how to use AI to score the all Resumes by matching it with Job profile**

Problem Statement: A Hr person is flooded with resume and spends hours manually checking each to find most suitable ones.

**How it works**
1. It is linked to Gmail Trigger which upon receving any mail with specific subject will check for the attachment.
2. Attachment will be parsed to understand the resume
3. Candidate informtion will be broken into Personal, Eductional and Professional type
4. Job profile will be pulled from Notion Board
5. A HR expert powered by Gemini LLM will score each profile on basis on its relevancy 
6. Information will be updated back to Gsheet 
7. Message lable will be updated back for clarity

**How to use**
1. The gmail trigger node is used as an example but feel free to replace this with other triggers such as webhook or even a form.


**Requirements**
Gemini account for LLM
Google sheet for upload
Gmail as trigger
Llama parse credentials

nodes.name: Wait to stay within service limits

filters.q: subject: Job application for SDR, has:attachment

options.systemPromptTemplate:
You are an expert extraction algorithm.
Only extract relevant information from the text.
If you do not know the value of an attribute asked to extract, you may omit the attribute's value.

attributes.name: City
attributes.description: Extract the city in which candidate is currently residing

attributes.name: Full Name
attributes.description: Extract the full name of candidate

attributes.name: Email
attributes.description: Extract the email of the candidate only.

attributes.name: Job History
attributes.description: Work history summary, mentioning all companies and duration worked, focusing major impactful achievements and work done.

attributes.name: Skills
attributes.description: Extract the candidate‚Äôs technical skills. What software, frameworks, functional, business skills they are proficient in. Make a bulleted list.

attributes.name: Title & Employer
attributes.description: Extract all Job Title and Employer with working years. For Example Job Title- Account Executive , Employer - SAP, Working Years - 2 Year, Job Title- Account Manager , Employer - Salesforce, Working Years - 3 Year. Combine the experience by Employer.

attributes.name: Work Experience
attributes.description: Extract years of experience and group experience by job function or role type. Format Example: Total Years Exp: 7 - Account Executive: 2 years - Sales Development Representative: 2 years - Account Manager: 3 years

attributes.name: Promotions Checker
attributes.description: For an employees, check if candidates designation has changed. Count total number of senior changes (i.e advancement in position) across the entire working experience.

attributes.name: Education Information
attributes.description: Create a tabular list of colleges, schools attended along with graduation degree, certification, passing year and any notable achievement in education.

parameters.text:
=Job Profile: {{ $json.url }}

Candidate Profile: {{ $('Merge1').item.json.output['Job History'] }},{{ $('Merge1').item.json.output.Skills }},{{ $('Merge1').item.json.output['Title & Employer'] }},{{ $('Merge1').item.json.output['Work Experience'] }},{{ $('Merge1').item.json.output['Education Information'] }},{{ $('Merge1').item.json.output['Full Name'] }},{{ $('Merge1').item.json.output.City }}

messageValues.message: You are an HR expert and you need to understand if the candidate  profile aligns with the job profile sought by the company. You must give a overall score from 1 to 10, where 1 means the candidate does not align with what is required, while 10 means they are the ideal candidate because they fully reflect the desired profile. Also, score on education qualification requirement, skills required and role and responsibility match from 1 to 10, where 1 means the lowest match. Furthermore, in the 'consideration' field, explain the reasoning behind your score in 100 words.

parameters.content:
## Step 1: Waiting for Resume.
This node is fetching resumes from Emails basis the specific Subject every hour.

## Data Extraction from Resume
This mode will identify personal, educational and professional info from Resume
## HR Expert to score the Candidate fitment
## Updating the Gsheet and Label to avoid duplication

main.node: Wait to stay within service limits
